title: Multi-Agent System for High-Frequency Trading

problem.description: Development of an intelligent system for high-frequency trading integrating autonomous agents, AI dashboards, backtesting, and LLM tooling. The goal was to create a scalable architecture combining low latency (C++) with advanced artificial intelligence (Python).
painPoints: Need for real-time execution with sub-millisecond latency
Complex integration between C++ and Python components
Real-time market data management with high reliability

solution.architecture: Multi-agent architecture with low-latency C++/Python pipeline. React 18 dashboard for real-time visualization, Python backtesting engine for strategy validation, LLM tooling for code-assist, C++ Market Data API with WebSockets/REST to feed ML pipelines.
keyDecisions: C++ for latency-critical components, Python for AI/ML
ClickHouse for real-time storage and analytics
OpenAI API and GitHub Copilot for development automation
solution.approach: Iterative development with focus on modularity. First implementation of basic data pipeline, then progressive addition of intelligent agents, dashboards and tooling. Continuous testing on historical data before live deployment.

metrics.label: Execution latency
metrics.description: Optimized C++ pipeline for sub-millisecond execution

metrics.label: System uptime
metrics.description: Resilient architecture with automatic error recovery

metrics.label: Dev productivity
metrics.description: Code-assist and automatic documentation via AI

results.impact: Scalable system combining HFT execution speed with AI agent intelligence. Real-time dashboard provides immediate insights, backtesting validates strategies before deployment, LLM tooling accelerates development and maintenance.

role: AI/ML agents development with Python and TensorFlow/PyTorch
LLM tooling integration for development assistance
